worklogs.comment:
nevi-me commented on pull request #5970: ARROW-7324: [Rust] Add timezone to timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5970
 
 
   This changes `DataType::TimeStamp(TimeUnit)` to `DataType::TimeStamp(TimeUnit, Option<String>)` where the `Option<String>` is an optional timezone.
   
   I would like some feedback on whether this option is fine. I haven't tried `Option<&str>` to avoid introducing a lifetime on the `DataType`.
   
   The timezone support should practically only affect temporal kernels (`fn value_as_date_time()`), but I haven't done anything there. This could be a follow up PR if there's a wider need for timezones in temporal kernels (I'll likely need them, but not urgent).
   
   Are you fine with the current proposal/implementation @andygrove @paddyhoran @sunchao @liurenjie1024 
   
   CC @andy-thomason to keep you in the loop.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

nevi-me commented on issue #5970: ARROW-7324: [Rust] Add timezone to timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5970#issuecomment-562451615
 
 
   The problem's that when we construct a timestamp array, there isn't a way of providing the timezone, resulting in all arrays constructed having `None` as a timezone. 
   
   The most primitive place where we need to pass the timezone data when building an array is in `ArrayData::builder(DataType)`.
   
   When constructing a `RecordBatch` or `StructArray`, we keep a copy of datatypes in the `Field` type, which can have a timezone as it's constructed separately from an array. This raises errors when trying to construct RB or SA because when we check datatype equality, we always compare `Some(timezone)` with `None` due to the array not having the timezone.
   
   I've found a dirty solution of creating `from_vec(Vec<i64>, tz)` and `from_opt_vec(Vec<Option<i64>>, tz)`, which addresses some of the problems with the above. I'm happy with the PR for now, and I can open a follow-up PR to provide more timezone-aware constructors (my intuition says there might be a few places I've missed).
   
   Let me know what you think @paddyhoran @liurenjie1024 , especially about the `from_vec` and `from_opt_vec`
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

liurenjie1024 commented on pull request #5970: ARROW-7324: [Rust] Add timezone to timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5970#discussion_r354694286
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/array/array.rs
 ##########
 @@ -622,6 +621,51 @@ def_numeric_from_vec!(
     DataType::Time64(TimeUnit::Nanosecond)
 );
 
+impl<T: ArrowTimestampType> PrimitiveArray<T> {
+    pub fn from_vec(data: Vec<i64>, timezone: Option<Arc<String>>) -> Self {
 
 Review comment:
   According to arrow's specification, only timestamp has timezone field, so maybe this only applies to TimestampArray. Or at least we should add some doc to state that timezone only applies to Timestamp array, others will be ignore. Also this implementation has much duplication with `From<Vec<i64>>`, so I think we should replace `From<Vec<i64>>`'s implementation with this one.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

liurenjie1024 commented on pull request #5970: ARROW-7324: [Rust] Add timezone to timestamp
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5970#discussion_r354694438
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/arrow/src/array/array.rs
 ##########
 @@ -622,6 +621,51 @@ def_numeric_from_vec!(
     DataType::Time64(TimeUnit::Nanosecond)
 );
 
+impl<T: ArrowTimestampType> PrimitiveArray<T> {
+    pub fn from_vec(data: Vec<i64>, timezone: Option<Arc<String>>) -> Self {
+        let array_data =
+            ArrayData::builder(DataType::Timestamp(T::get_time_unit(), timezone))
+                .len(data.len())
+                .add_buffer(Buffer::from(data.to_byte_slice()))
+                .build();
+        PrimitiveArray::from(array_data)
+    }
+}
+
+impl<T: ArrowTimestampType> PrimitiveArray<T> {
 
 Review comment:
   Similar to above comment
